intro: Pilosella guthnikiana, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cold, high-altitude environments. It features small, grayish-green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Pilosella guthnikiana is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
